column1: pushed flat on good length on middle, shaping away, defended off the back foot
good length, middle stump, pushed off the back foot with the spin, to deep midwicket
arm ball first up. Good length, coming in from outside off, tries to chop it fine, beaten
good length on off stump, angling in, forward defence
good length on off stump, pushed off the front foot to cover

arm ball again, this time drifts down to the pads. He reaches out and just about manages to get bat, turns his wrists to get it past short fine leg's left, and he has to slide to keep it in at the boundary line
good length on off stump, swings in slightly, gets a big stride and pushes it to mid off
shapes it in again but slightly shorter and straighter. Catches him on the thigh guard as he attempts a glance through the open square leg region
middle stump, good length. Tries to swing it away, but there's no bend this time. Played with soft hands to mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, gets on his toes and glances it to deep square leg
full on off stump, moves away very slightly, short stride and gets good bat on his straight drive but it's straight at the bowler

GOT HIM! Back of a length in the corridor and going away, doesn't quite rise enough for his attempted pull shot and he's dragged it on. Good captaincy there. Pushed fine leg back, brought square leg in and forced Klinger to go for that swipe across the line
good length on the pads, he tries to flick and is beaten. There's a sound and the keeper goes up straight away, but not out says the umpire
good length, pushed across the left hander, he waits and pushes it to midwicket

PLUMB! Great bowling by Beer! Stays around the wicket to Bell, gives him the arm ball first up, and traps him on the back foot right in front of middle stump. He expected that to turn and was trying to make room to punch through covers off the back foot. Too soon in the innings, and that's a golden duck
tossed up outside off, stretches far forward and pushes with hard hands to cover
arm ball on middle, angles in and hits him on the thigh pad

100 kph, another arm ball! Dreadful shot from Bancroft. Has premeditated the paddle sweep and goes down early to get in position, but is beaten by pace and trapped in front of the middle stump. He looks disappointed with the decision but he won't be when he sees the replays
short and wide, frees his arms and slaps it through cover
back of a length on middle stump, ties him up on the back foot and he can only defend
short of length, angled across the left-hander, he chops it down to third man from waist height
back of a length, angled into the batsman, he gets up on his toes and pushes it to mid-on
good length on middle, angled away, offers the full face and pushes it back to the bowler

Oh dear, what's happening here? Back of a length on the pads, he gets bat on his leg glance, it goes slightly uppishly and finds Beer at short fine leg who takes it on the second attempt low to his right
good length on off stump, forward defence
arm ball, middle stump, good length, forward block
arm ball on middle stump, gives him the charge and jams it out to long-off
101 kph, slides in from a short length on middle stump and catches him on the pads
fired in full on the leg, tries to flick it and misses
good length on off stump, steps out and drives straight to mid-off
good length in the corridor, clears his front foot and tries to slap it over the bowler, beaten by a fair distance
back of a length at off stump, attempts a wild slog, beaten again
connects this time! Back of a length, sits up over off stump, stays put in his crease and swings it hard over midwicket
bouncer outside off, he throws his arms at it and is beaten
back of a length in the corridor, tries to go for class this time, as opposed to power. But he's not good enough to connect that back foot punch through cover
good length on off, tries to slap it over covers, beaten
good length on off, comes in to Tye this time, and he uses the angle to lift it on the up over midwicket. Pietersen would be proud of that shot
full on stump, moves away slightly, cover drive gets the bottom of the bat and goes straight to cover
back of a length on off stump, sits up nicely and he swivels to pull this past deep square
attempts the pull again, but it's slightly fuller this time and he can only get it into the pitch and back to the bowler
good length outside off, tries to carve it through off side but tries too hard, inside edge back to the bowler again
slower ball on a good length outside off, pushed away to sweeper
short on middle, gets deep into his crease and just about connects the hook shot
short and wide, slaps it off the back foot in the air, and dropped by Luke Wright at point. It went low to his right but by no means was it difficult
back of a length on middle, tries to shovel it into the leg side off the back foot, doesn't make sufficient contact
good length, slides down the leg side
136 kph, well directed bouncer that climbs on the batsman and catches him on the bicep, completely avoiding his wild slog

Another bouncer, and this time it gets a top edge. This one climbs in the corridor from short of good length, and he gets one hand off the bat, baseball-style, as it is too fast on him and his hoick. Balloons up nicely for the keeper a few yards from his spot
back of a length on off stump, slogs at it, bat turns in his hands, rolls into the leg side feebly
loses direction on this bouncer and it flies past the batsman's left shoulder. The crowd bringing out an ironic cheer.
back of length on middle, tries to tuck it into the leg side, but only tucks himself, cops a blow on his thigh, and scrambles across for a single
good length outside off, fended back to the bowler
leg cutter, back of a length outside off, but doesn't deviate much. Walks across his stumps and pushes it to midwicket
leg cutter again. Middle stump, cramps him for room. He was look to slap that through the off side, but can only push it back to the bowler
full on middle stump, clears his front foot and slogs it, along the ground to deep square
slower ball on middle, shuffles across, soft-hands it to midwicket's right

HUGE! He misses his length on change-up  - and off cutter. Good length, just outside off, and has room to swing hard at this. It's gone high, straight over the bowler, hits the railings on the top tier and bounces down into the top of the sightscreen, where it seems to have found a nice spot and refuses to come down
good length, sliding into the pads, pushed to the square leg region and David Hussey keeps them down to single after some footwork
short and angled into the pads, stands his ground and turns it around the fine leg boundary
short and wide, stands back and slaps it to the right of sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, connects the slog, but catches the bottom of the bat. Pushes deep square and completes the second easily
short on middle, middles his pull shot but can't get any elevation. One bounce and straight to fine leg
back of a length slower ball outside off, pushed off the back foot to point
fired in full at leg stump, he steps out, converts it into a full toss and thumps it past the bowler. Long-on puts in a dive after running to his left, but it's too fast
tossed wide outside off, steps out and drags it to long-on
102 kph, wide and full, steps out and tries to throw his hands at it. Bottom of the bat, straight to long-off
missed stumping. Fired in on middle, misses his flick after stepping out, goes between bat and pads and Handscomb can't collect it low
yorker outside off, steps out and just manages to get bat and hit it out to sweeper
yorker outside off, stays in his crease and tries to carve it, beaten
bouncer follows the batsman down leg, he tries to pull but doesn't have room. But it lands safely in front of deep midwicket
full on middle stump, short stride across and pushed to long-on
bouncer on off stump, tries to arc backwards and scoop it past the keeper from eye-level, but doesn't get bat on it
full on off stump, in his arc, spanked down to the left of long-off, who gets across and puts in a nice slide. Fumbles at the last minute, but he's done well to save the boundary
slower ball, good length on middle stump, turned away with a lot of effort to deep square
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full and wide, gets on one knee and slaps it to sweeper cover
good length leg cutter outside off, sliced down to third man off the front foot
full outside off, mid-off is inside the circle and Tye has slapped it between him and the bowler
in the block hole on off stump, clears his leg and squeezes it to long-on
full outside off, gets a stride across and clips it to long-on
overpitched outside off, angled in slightly, and he yorks himself and gets an inside edge onto pad on his slog. Rolls back to the bowler
slower ball outside off, tries to glance it to third man, gets an outside edge that lands in front of Handscomb
length ball angled into the pads, puts in a short stride, tries to clear the deep midwicket fielder with a slog, but it's a big ground and he hasn't got enough bat on that. Simple catch.

back of a length slower ball outside off, sits up nicely and he's got everything on his pull shot. Superb work at midwicket. Dives to his right and stops that. They run as the ball goes a couple of yards away from the fielder. He recovers and throws it back and Tye has to put in a 6 yard dive. Referred to the third umpire....and not-out.
slower bouncer outside off, jumps up in the air and tries to turn it to fine leg, gets an inside edge and it goes one bounce to the keeper
yorker on leg stump, driven down to long-on with the bottom of the bat
good length, angled across the left-hander. He slashes at it and it goes under his bat
around the wicket, full and angled across the batsman outside off, and he slices it to the left of Kevin Pieteresen at mid-off

low full toss, angled across Tye outside off, he wants to hit this over mid-off, but gets the bottom. Hussey, having just moved to mid-off, times his jump to perfection and snaps it up. The crowd's new favourite batsman is gone.
good length outside off, goes back and plays into the off side infield with soft hands
short ball into the ribs, he's late on the hook but gets enough bat to hit it to deep square
138 kph, bouncer outside off, there's room but it climbs nastily and past his hook shot
good length outside off, gives it the charge and tries to open the face to run it down to third man, beaten on the outside edge
full and wide across the left-hander, minimal footwork, throws his hands and slices it aerially past point's ambitious left-arm
full on middle stump, walks across and flicks it to midwicket
good length outside off, tries to drive it, sans footwork, through the covers. Finds the fielder
good length, angled into the leg stump, pushed to midwicket
back of a length on middle, pushed down to long-on off the back foot
back of a length, angled across the left-hander, pulled straight to midwicket
slower ball wide outside off, he drags it of the back foot and gets it past midwicket who is a couple of yards inside the circle
midwicket has gone back now, and he lifts this good length ball on middle stump off the front foot in his direction - one bounce

slower ball on middle stump, backs away well past leg stump to find the gap between mid-off and extra cover, but there isn't enough pace. He slips and loses his bat as he runs, but it's all good in the end. Relatively.
full and wide, well past the wide marker
full on off stump, and this time he gets it over midwicket! Front foot out of the way, lifts it cleanly over deep midwicket
full and wide, this was hittable, but he goes too hard and it slides under his bat and straight to the keeper
full outside off, throws his bat at it, but it rotates in his hand. Chips it just over cover and the sweeper comes across
walks across his stumps, gets followed, yorks himself and hits it back to the bowler
he walks across his stumps again, he's followed again. He tries to lift that over fine leg, but the low full toss gets and outside edge and absolutely zooms into the third man boundary
slower good length ball outside off, stays his ground and swipes across at it, missed by a fair distance
WHACK! Low full toss outside off, stands his ground and slaps it past his partner and mid-off
slower short ball on middle, pulled to the right of deep midwicket
short slower ball outside off, and he's got good bat on his pull shot. Goes to the left of long-off
around the wicket, slower ball on middle, dabbed into the leg side
bouncer over middle stump, he makes room and tries to slap it away, but can't connect. The crowd boos the umpire. They reckon that was a wide
full and angled across Agar, who backs away too much and can't connect
he doesn't back away this time, but the ball is wider and he misses it again. Handscomb fumbles and short third man has to clean up
around the wicket, yorker outside off, jammed out to point
full and tailing away outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, angled across, pulled straight to deep midwicket

good length, follows him down the leg side. He tries to power it inside out over mid-off, but gets the bottom. Hilfenhaus runs in from deep cover and slides on his knees to catch that, but it's well short
yorker on middle stump, gets deep and middles it, but it goes straight to long-on
full and wide outside off, he tries to slice it over point but can't get connection on it
full outside off, takes two steps across his stumps and slaps it flat, and straight over the bowler for a six. Sweet connection.

short slower ball outside off, he gets across and tries to power it over long-on. Gets a top edge, it goes over mid-off, who runs backwards and puts in a throw. Agar slips again as he tries to complete the second and the bowler has a shy at the striker's end. The throw is much too wide and much too short of Handscomb, who can't gather it. Instead, chucks his left glove off immediately and nurses his fingers. He's in some pain. The crowd is happy with this total and they send their team off vociferously
139 kph, good length on off stump, pushes at it nervously, thick outside edge to third man
141 kph, good length outside off, angles away but nips back slightly. He shoulders arms without covering his off stump
141 kph, back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes and cuts it down into the ground, misfield at gully
143 kph, bouncer in line with the batsman, but wayyyyy too high for anyone. Flies about 5 yards over the keeper
good length outside off, back foot defence
142 kph, short outside off, tries to pull this put he's too early at it and it flies through to Bancroft at eye-level. Connection on that would've taken it out of the stadium, I reckon
graceful. Good length outside off, short stride, slightly away from the body, but controls his punch on the up beautifully and rolls away quickly past Agar at mid-off and into the boundary
good length, angled in at off stump, no feet, pushed with hard hands to mid-off
good length on off, slightly fuller than the last one, drives it on the up, but straight to mid-off again
back of a length in the corridor, scrambles his feet to get in position and runs it down to third man with an open face
Dropped! short and wide, wants to place his cut behind point, but gets an edge and it flies quickly and high to Turner at first slip, and bursts through his hands
short of a length on middle, creams the pull shot, straight to deep square
good length on off stump, angled in, tucks him up and he fends it to cover off the front foot
142 kph, good length, wide outside off, but he's somehow dragged this on the up to the midwicket boundary. Whew, some connection there. A couple of bounces and four
Lovely. Lovely. Full on off stump, hangs in his crease, lets it come to him, maintains his balance and punches it past the non-striker
good length on off stump, thick outside edge to third man
141 kph, good length on off stump, backs away slightly, opens the face and it bounces over gully and goes to third man
123 kph, slower ball on a length outside the off, pushes it confidently on the up to mid-on
good length, angled into the pads, he jumps and tries to tuck it past short fine, but misses and takes it in the thigh
short of good length outside off, slams the pull shot but straight to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, tries to cream his cut shot but there isn't enough width. It flies over first slip
back of a length, cramps him on middle stump at waist height, he can only defend it
GREAT BOUNCER. There's the breakthrough. 144 kph, aimed straight at his chest  and it's too fast for his hook shot. No feet, swivels slightly, top-edge, straight to fine-leg.
back of a length, angled across off stump, gets back and across and punches it nicely through covers and they've run four!
146 kph, back of a length angled across off, waits for it and glides it late to the third man boundary. Quiney in total control
back of a length on middle, angled across, he walks across the stump and tries to flick him behind square, can't connect
short and aimed for the ribs, jumps up, gets on top of it, and fends it one-handed to short fine
143 kph, oomph! Short of a length outside off, climbs on him rapidly. Goes for the pull, gets a top edge and cops it on the helmet and it flies down to third man
short and angled across, jumps up, soft hands, into the off side and easy single
Anti-climax. The crowd roars him on, he runs in and bowls a full slower ball on middle stump, which is pushed straight to midwicket

143 kph, back of a length on top of off, goes under his attempted pull. Bancroft has turned into a mad man behind the stump as he runs in 20 yards towards the batsman with his appeal. He's the only one on the ground doing it.
full on off stump, tails in slightly, Pietersen puts in a stride and punches it slightly to the left of mid-on, who dives to his left
good length on middle, whipped to the right of midwicket who put it in a dive and recovers quickly to throw at the non-strikers, but KP has just made it
good length angled across, chopped down to third man

dropped 112 kph, slower ball on off stump, KP wants to hit this over the bowler, but he gets one hand off the bat and slices it HIGH over cover, but Klinger has run all around this and has to put in a desperate backwards dive and makes a meal of it
slower ball outside off, tries to push it into the off side, inside edge on to the pads and lands to the right of the pitch
short and sliding down the leg, glanced off his hips to short fine, who has a shy at the non-strikers but his throw flies well over the stumps
floated in slow and full on off, dragged out to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, steps out and chips it over midwicket
flighted on off stump, waits for it this time and flicks it deep midwicket
fired in on good length at off stump, steps out and can't get to the pitch. His slog lands in front of deep midwicket by some distance
flat on middle, steps out and pushes to deep midwicket
100kph, arm ball outside off, gets down and tries to play a reverse sweep fine. Beaten.
good length on middle, angling across, tries to drop it into the off side but gets and inside edge on to his boot

good length, angling in, he puts a big stride forward and tries to whip it. Caught on the pads and it looks close, but not-out. In the meantime, KP has meandered down the wicket and has to dive back to make his crease. Point has run in fast and put in an under-arm diving throw. Would've been out with a direct hit
follows him down the leg with a bouncer, too high
good length on middle stump, back away and tries to slog it. Inside edge, into the pitch and back to the bowler, who has a shy at his old team-mate. KP getting impatient.
good length outside off, in control this time as he runs it down to third man
GONE! Good length on middle, tries to whip this over the midwicket boundary, but it gets a little away from his reach and he slices it straight up. Point gets under it, is patient and grabs it nicely
good length, angled into the pads, whipped down to fine leg
good length, spinning away from off stump, tries to whip it to the leg side. Leading edge back to the bowler
short and wide, cut straight to point
floated on good length at off stump, pushed through cover off the front foot
97 kph, pushed flat on middle stump, steps out and turns it behind square on the leg side
full on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
good length on off stump, he steps out but is beaten in flight. Check drive back to the bowler who dives to his left and saves the single
short slower ball on middle, steps out and lifts it on the up straight over the bowler. Slightly high on the bat but it's gone 80 metres
short on middle, absolutely nails a front-foot pull shot straight to deep square
good length on off stump, goes forward and pushes to the right of point

slower bouncer on middle, waits on it, gets the pull shot bang in the middle again. This time he rolls his wrists and places it to the right of deep square who puts in a dive but pushes it into the boundary with his momentum
steps out, gets followed and misses out on his slog. Inside edge. Good take from Bancroft.
full on off stump, slapped off the front foot past the bowler. Mid-off gets across, gets low, but deflects it to long-on. Shouldn't have been a run
slower full fall on off stump, gives him the charge and punches it through covers where Klinger is close and put in a dive to his right to stop it. Good work
floats a slower ball full outside off, gets low and creams it to deep cover
bouncer down the leg, gets the hook in the middle of the bat and hits it to fine leg
back of a length in the corridor, pushed back to the bowler
good length in the corridor, gets the outside edge and goes past the keeper. But KP was in control here.
yorker on middle stump, walks across the stump and hits it on the full to midwicket
back of a length, angling in to the pads, gets in the air and glances it to the right of midwicket

STRANGE SHOT. Short and angling into the pads. He should have put that pull shot away, but checks his shot for some reason. Lack of intent? Don't know, but it catches the top edge and goes through at about Stanlake's height, straight to short midwicket
angled in at off stump, short of a length, plays it late off the back foot and down to third man
back of a length in the corridor, gets high on the ball, waits for it and drops it in front of point with soft hands
short and angled into the pads. This is what Handscomb should have done, in hindsight. Glanced off his hips to fine leg

bouncer angled towards his left shoulder, he's taken it on and gets a glove on it. Floats seductively over the keeper and just eludes him as he puts in the jump and gets a couple of bounces before rolling past the boundary line
back of the hand slower ball, good length on off stump, tries to drop it into the off side to take a single, but the fielder at point is quick
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full slower ball on middle stump, driven down to long-on
short and wide outside off, cut away to deep cover
good length, angled in from off stump, struck him plumb in front of off stump, but he's got an inside edge on it
short on middle stump, jumps up in the air and pokes at it with no conviction. JUST falls short of short midwicket
back of a length, off stump, pushed to mid-off of the back foot
good length wide outside off, frees his arms and slices it over point
bouncer on middle stump, backs away towards the leg stump and swats it straight to deep square
short and wide, cut away hard, straight to deep cover

back of a length, middle stump, Pietersen puts a trademark stride forward and across and plays a slog that would've gotten him suspended from any academy 20 years ago. Perhaps that explains the migration....
good length outside off, pushed into the open cover region
full slower ball outside off, backs away, slaps it to cover
full outside off, gets across, mistimes his slog and it goes straight to long-on

OOOOO! Full and wide, slices it uppishly to the right of cover, who dives and catches it low to his right. Or has he? He doesn't know. Neither to the umpires. It's being reviewed. Looks like it's bounced JUST in front. Tough call this. Very ambiguous. Somebody is going to get the benefit of the doubt...it's the batsman.
back of a length on middle stump, lifts the pull shot over midwicket and comes back for an easy second
short of a length on leg stump, and it's caught him straight in the box. Talk about middling it. He uses adrenaline to get across the wicket, but has run out and is on the floor now
good length on middle, waits for it and plays chops it at the last nanosecond, down to third man
full and angled in on middle stump, tries to push it nto the leg side but catches him on the pad. Big appeal, might have been sliding down.
floated on off stump, good length, steps down, doesn't get to the pitch and hammers it into the pitch. Comes back hard at Agar, who pulls out the old matrix and catches it to the right of his head
good length on middle stump, driven to long on
good length, angled into the pad, pushed to midwicket
good length on off, steps out again, doesn't get to the pitch, again. Swats at it, goes high to the left of long-off, and falls safely
107 kph, fired in at a length at leg stump, makes room, pushes it to cover, who runs in and thinks about the throw before he gets to the ball and hence fumbles
slower ball, full on off stump, frees his arms and thumps it past the non-striker. No chance for the fielder at long-on
short and wide, another slower ball, throws his hands at it early and chips it over cover
low full toss, lifts it with the angle, doesn't put much effort into that shot. Johnson jumps too early on the boundary line and misses it
short and wide, slower ball, tries to swipe it past point but it goes under his bat
OOOOOO says the entire crowd, as he powers this length ball straight past Tye's face
full slower ball outside off, waits for it and lifts it nicely over Tye. Just about clears the boundary
good length, pushed on to the pads, gets a big stride and pushes it through square leg
good length, fired in on middle stump, gives him the charge and lifts it on the up. Long-off gets across and takes the catch, but he's over the boundary line, and that's the victory for Stars
